2301.definition: [θεατρίζω] from {{G2302}}; to expose as a spectacle

2302.definition: [θέατρον] from {{G2300}}; a place for public show ("theatre"), i.e. general audience-room; by implication, a show itself (figuratively)

2303.definition: [θεῖον] probably neuter of {{G2304}} (in its original sense of flashing); sulphur

2307.definition: [θέλημα] from the prolonged form of {{G2309}}; a determination (properly, the thing), i.e. (actively) choice (specially, purpose, decree; abstractly, volition) or (passively) inclination

2308.definition: [θέλησις] from {{G2309}}; determination (properly, the act), i.e. option

2309.definition: [θέλω]   or ἐθέλω,    in certain tenses      θελέω,  and ἐθελέω, which are otherwise obsolete apparently strengthened from the alternate form of {{G138}}; to determine (as an active option from subjective impulse; whereas {{G1014}} properly denotes rather a passive acquiescence in objective considerations), i.e. choose or prefer (literally or figuratively); by implication, to wish, i.e. be inclined to (sometimes adverbially, gladly); impersonally for the future tense, to be about to; by Hebraism, to delight in

2310.definition: [θεμέλιος] from a derivative of {{G5087}}; something put down, i.e. a substruction (of a building, etc.), (literally or figuratively)

2311.definition: [θεμελιόω] from {{G2310}}; to lay a basis for, i.e. (literally) erect, or (figuratively) consolidate

2314.definition: [θεομάχος] from {{G2316}} and {{G3164}}; an opponent of deity

2315.definition: [θεόπνευστος] from {{G2316}} and a presumed derivative of {{G4154}}; divinely breathed in

2316.definition: [θεός] of uncertain affinity; a deity, especially (with {{G3588}}) the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very

2318.definition: [θεοσεβής] from {{G2316}} and {{G4576}}; reverent of God, i.e. pious

2319.definition: [θεοστυγής] from {{G2316}} and the base of {{G4767}}; hateful to God, i.e. impious

2321.definition: [Θεόφιλος] from {{G2316}} and {{G5384}}; friend of God; Theophilus, a Christian

2322.definition: [θεραπεία] from {{G2323}}; attendance (specially, medical, i.e. cure); figuratively and collectively, domestics

2323.definition: [θεραπεύω] from the same as {{G2324}}; to wait upon menially, i.e. (figuratively) to adore (God), or (specially) to relieve (of disease)

2324.definition: [θεράπων] apparently a participle from an otherwise obsolete derivative of the base of {{G2330}}; a menial attendant (as if cherishing)

2325.definition: [θερίζω] from {{G2330}} (in the sense of the crop); to harvest

2330.definition: [θέρος] from a primary θέρω (to heat); properly, heat, i.e. summer

2331.definition: [Θεσσαλονικεύς] from {{G2332}}; a Thessalonican, i.e. inhabitant of Thessalonice

2332.definition: [Θεσσαλονίκη] from Θεσσαλός (a Thessalian) and {{G3529}}; Thessalonice, a place in Asia Minor

2333.definition: [Θευδᾶς] of uncertain origin; Theudas, an Israelite

2334.definition: [θεωρέω] from a derivative of {{G2300}} (perhaps by addition of {{G3708}}); to be a spectator of, i.e. discern, (literally, figuratively (experience) or intensively (acknowledge)) Compare {{G3700}}.

2335.definition: [θεωρία] from the same as {{G2334}}; spectatorship, i.e. (concretely) a spectacle

2337.definition: [θηλάζω] from θηλή (the nipple); to suckle, (by implication) to suck

2339.definition: [θήρα] from θήρ (a wild animal, as game); hunting, i.e. (figuratively) destruction

2340.definition: [θηρεύω] from {{G2339}}; to hunt (an animal), i.e. (figuratively) to carp at

2341.definition: [θηριομαχέω] from a compound of {{G2342}} and {{G3164}}; to be a beast-fighter (in the gladiatorial show), i.e. (figuratively) to encounter (furious men)

2342.definition: [θηρίον] diminutive from the same as {{G2339}}; a dangerous animal

2343.definition: [θησαυρίζω] from {{G2344}}; to amass or reserve (literally or figuratively)

2344.definition: [θησαυρός] from {{G5087}}; a deposit, i.e. wealth (literally or figuratively)

2345.definition: [θιγγάνω] a prolonged form of an obsolete primary θίγω (to finger); to manipulate, i.e. have to do with; by implication, to injure

2346.definition: [θλίβω] akin to the base of {{G5147}}; to crowd (literally or figuratively)

2348.definition: [θνήσκω] a strengthened form of a simpler primary θάνω (which is used for it only in certain tenses); to die (literally or figuratively)

2350.definition: [θορυβέω] from {{G2351}}; to be in tumult, i.e. disturb, clamor

2351.definition: [θόρυβος] from the base of {{G2360}}; a disturbance

2352.definition: [θραύω] a primary verb; to crush Compare {{G4486}}.

2353.definition: [θρέμμα] from {{G5142}}; stock (as raised on a farm)

2356.definition: [θρησκεία] from a derivative of {{G2357}}; ceremonial observance

2357.definition: [θρησκός] probably from the base of {{G2360}}; ceremonious in worship (as demonstrative), i.e. pious

2358.definition: [θριαμβεύω] from a prolonged compound of the base of {{G2360}}; and a derivative of {{G680}} (meaning a noisy iambus, sung in honor of Bacchus); to make an acclamatory procession, i.e. (figuratively) to conquer or (by Hebraism) to give victory

2359.definition: [θρίξ] genitive case τριχός, etc.; of uncertain derivation; hair Compare {{G2864}}.

2360.definition: [θροέω] from θρέομαι to wail; to clamor, i.e. (by implication) to frighten

2361.definition: [θρόμβος] perhaps from {{G5142}} (in the sense of thickening); a clot

2362.definition: [θρόνος] from θράω (to sit); a stately seat ("throne"); by implication, power or (concretely) a potentate

2363.definition: [Θυάτειρα] of uncertain derivation; Thyatira, a place in Asia Minor

2364.definition: [θυγάτηρ] apparently a primary word (compare "daughter"); a female child, or (by Hebraism) descendant (or inhabitant)

2366.definition: [θύελλα] from {{G2380}} (in the sense of blowing) a storm

2367.definition: [θύϊνος] from a derivative of {{G2380}} (in the sense of blowing; denoting a certain fragrant tree); made of citron-wood

2368.definition: [θυμίαμα] from {{G2370}}; an aroma, i.e. fragrant powder burnt in religious service; by implication, the burning itself

2369.definition: [θυμιαστήριον] from a derivative of {{G2370}}; a place of fumigation, i.e. the alter of incense (in the Temple)

2370.definition: [θυμιάω] from a derivative of {{G2380}} (in the sense of smoking); to fumigate, i.e. offer aromatic fumes

2371.definition: [θυμομαχέω] from a presumed compound of {{G2372}} and {{G3164}}; to be in a furious fight, i.e. (figuratively) to be exasperated

2372.definition: [θυμός] from {{G2380}}; passion (as if breathing hard) Compare {{G5590}}.

2373.definition: [θυμόω] from {{G2372}}; to put in a passion, i.e. enrage

2374.definition: [θύρα] apparently a primary word (compare "door"); a portal or entrance (the opening or the closure, literally or figuratively)

2377.definition: [θυρωρός] from {{G2374}} and οὖρος (a watcher); a gate- warden

2378.definition: [θυσία] from {{G2380}}; sacrifice (the act or the victim, literally or figuratively)

2379.definition: [θυσιαστήριον] from a derivative of {{G2378}}; a place of sacrifice, i.e. an altar (special or genitive case, literal or figurative)

2380.definition: [θύω] a primary verb; properly, to rush (breathe hard, blow, smoke), i.e. (by implication) to sacrifice (properly, by fire, but genitive case); by extension to immolate (slaughter for any purpose)

2381.definition: [Θωμᾶς] of Chaldee origin (compare {{H8380}}); the twin; Thomas, a Christian

2382.definition: [θώραξ] of uncertain affinity; the chest ("thorax"), i.e. (by implication) a corslet

2383.definition: [Ἰάειρος] of Hebrew origin ({{H2971}}); Jairus (i.e. Jair), an Israelite

2384.definition: [Ἰακώβ] of Hebrew origin ({{H3290}}); Jacob (i.e. Ja`akob), the progenitor of the Israelites

2385.definition: [Ἰάκωβος] the same as {{G2384}} Græcized; Jacobus, the name of three Israelites

2387.definition: [Ἰαμβρῆς] of Egyptian origin; Jambres, an Egyptian

2388.definition: [Ἰαννά] probably of Hebrew origin (compare {{H3238}}); Janna, an Israelite

2389.definition: [Ἰαννῆς] of Egyptian origin; Jannes, an Egyptian

2390.definition: [ἰάομαι] middle voice of apparently a primary verb; to cure (literally or figuratively)

2391.definition: [Ἰάρεδ] of Hebrew origin ({{H3382}}); Jared (i.e. Jered), an antediluvian

2393.definition: [ἴασπις] probably of foreign origin (see {{H3471}}); "jasper", a gem

2394.definition: [Ἰάσων] future active participle masculine of {{G2390}}; about to cure; Jason, a Christian

2396.definition: [ἴδε] second person singular imperative active of {{G1492}}; used as an interjection to denote surprise; lo!

2397.definition: [ἰδέα] from {{G1492}}; a sight (comparative figuratively "idea"), i.e. aspect

2398.definition: [ἴδιος] of uncertain affinity; pertaining to self, i.e. one's own; by implication, private or separate

2399.definition: [ἰδιώτης] from {{G2398}}; a private person, i.e. (by implication) an ignoramus (compare "idiot")

2400.definition: [ἰδού] second person singular imperative middle voice of {{G1492}}; used as imperative lo!;
